A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: I felt obligated to write this after reading stories discrediting fan disappointment in The NY Times. First let me say that I really enjoyed A Force Awakens\, and Rogue One. I grew up on the original 3\, and the 3 prequels aren’t worth discussing because they are just awful. I’ve never read any books\, I walked into the theater with no theories\, I had no real expectations. This movie was so bad I nearly walked out\, and I’m still kicking myself for not. This movie tries to do far too much\, and it fails to do just about anything it set out to do. The character development is poor for the most part\, the nostalgic references aren’t enough to salvage it\, and of none of the Central storylines captivate or satisfy. All in all it tends to be a boring cringeworthy mess. I’ll leave it at that without going into spoilers\, because if you are anything like me you have to see to believe. They’ve made a mess of this in a manner I thought only George Lucas was capable of doing
